title: EU ambassadors’ Brexit meeting delayed again
text:
The two sides appear to be close to a deal | Kenzo Tribouillard/AFP via Getty Images EU ambassadors’ Brexit meeting delayed again Article 50 meeting had originally been due to go ahead at 2 p.m.

A key meeting in Brussels at which EU ambassadors were due to be briefed by the bloc’s chief negotiator Michel Barnier on progress in the Brexit talks has been postponed again, according to three diplomats.

The Coreper Article 50 meeting had originally been due to go ahead at 2 p.m. today. It was then pushed back to 5 p.m. and with talks continuing it has been delayed again until 7 p.m.

The two sides appear to be close to a deal, although Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar hinted earlier today that a further EU leaders’ summit may be required later this month to reach an agreement.
description: Article 50 meeting had originally been due to go ahead at 2 p.m.
